is an inland county in the
region of California.  Except for a small area at the extreme north end of the county, it is hot, dry, and mountainous.

San Benito County is predominantly rural and mountainous.  About 2/3 of the population of the county live in the county seat of Hollister. The county is named after San Benito Valley, which was named by Father Juan Cresp√≠ in honor of San Benedicto, the patron saint of the married.

The state gem of California, benitoite, is named after the county.  While the mineral exists elsewhere, this is the only place in the world where it exists in gem quality.
The main gateway to the county is U.S. 101 which cuts through the northwest corner of the county.  The southern portion of the county can be accessed via CA-146 from

There are no commercial airports in the county; however, there are nearby airports that can be used to reach the county.
